title: Big PE players shortlisted for Archer Capital's illion
text:
And finally there is Bain Capital, which has form winning private equity shootouts as seen when it picked up after hours school care provider Camp Australia in late 2016.

The four firms are understood to dominate the shortlist.

While there is plenty left to play out in the auction, it appears the financial sponsors agreed with Archer Capital's "marquee asset" pitch for illion - or at least enough to justify a healthy indicative bid - and believe that it should be supported by increasing regulation and debt in coming years.

They also probably realise that a handful of the potential strategic buyers, including Transunion and Expedia, are otherwise occupied and opted to give illion a miss.

The question is whether Archer and its bankers at Houlihan Lokey and Citi were able to get a strategic investor into the final field to at least keep the private equity firms honest. The sell-side were earlier talking up illion's infrastructure-like properties in an effort to capture the attention of a cashed-up core-plus fund.

Archer Capital is understood to be asking for binding bids in late November, which means a reasonably tight auction timetable that should play into the private equity firms' hands.

illion is expected to be worth about $1.5 billion, based on $89 million forecast EBITDA in the 2020 financial year and a high-teens multiple. Interested parties were also told to expect $226 million revenue this fiscal year.

Investment bankers will be circling the shortlisted parties in coming weeks, seeking to lock down buy-side mandates. The private equity firms will no doubt be after some big promises on debt pricing and terms. Similar businesses offshore are geared at about seven-times EBITDA.

Should the auction pan out as expected, illion may well be the next in a growing number of secondary Australian private equity deals. Only last week we saw Affinity Equity Partners sign TEG's $1.3 billion sale to Silver Lake.
description: The auction for data registries and analytics business illion is the hottest private equity shootout this year.
